answers.answer: there is nothing for you do aside from maintaining an otherwise healthy lifestyle, ie no drinking alcohol, not being overweight.  this will prevent diabetes and in theory allow the liver to regenerate

question: my liver was damaged after surgery with levels 80/260 AST/ALT and I felt nauseous and was bedridden for months barely able to speak or think or type (also lost my energy and libido).  is there anything I can do to heal my liver and regain energy?  so it's best that I never drink again?as we grow older and the liver becomes damaged does that damage your cognition and cause diabetes complications?  thanks!
title: liver damage after surgery
